items.label: Who?
items.description: Preparation for short- and long-track Gymnasium entrance exams, HMS/BMS/FMS admissions, and the BM2 final exam with structured 1:1 coaching for students across Zurich and Switzerland.

items.label: What?
items.description: Diagnostic kick-off, tailored learning plans, adaptive practice sets, proctored mock exams with video debriefs, and mindset coaching for time and stress management.

items.label: Where?
items.description: 100% online via Zoom with shared whiteboard, optional recordings, and bilingual materials in German, Italian, and English.

items.label: Pricing
items.description: Single session CHF 70, 5-pack CHF 300, 10-pack CHF 550 (approx. 2 lessons per week), 13-pack CHF 650 (approx. 3 lessons per week) ‚Äì includes follow-up notes, progress tracking, and typically a response within 24 hours on business days. Final prices in CHF; service not VAT-registered. No additional payment fees.

items.label: How to start?
items.description: Send a WhatsApp message ‚Üí receive a free consultation within 24 hours ‚Üí lock in dates and activate your Calendesk-based learning plan.

intentClusters.title: Audience
intentClusters.body: I support students across Switzerland who need focused math coaching to succeed in demanding entrance exams.

intentClusters.title: What‚Äôs included
intentClusters.body: Foundation building, exam strategies, personalised practice sets, ongoing feedback, and weekly progress tracking.

intentClusters.title: Gymipr√ºfung & BMS/HMS/FMS
intentClusters.body: Work through common task formats, sharpen time management, analyse mistakes, and run full mock exams.

intentClusters.title: Pricing approach
intentClusters.body: Transparent hourly rates, discounted 5-, 10-, and 13-lesson bundles, and custom proposals for longer engagements.

intentClusters.title: Delivery model
intentClusters.body: Live Zoom lessons with shared whiteboard, tailored materials, and homework feedback between sessions.

intentClusters.title: Booking & response
intentClusters.body: Flexible online booking with reliable follow-up ‚Äì inquiries are typically answered within 24 hours on business days.

services.title: Services
services.description: Tailored tutoring programmes ranging from long-term foundations to last-minute refreshers.

items.name: Gymnasium prep
items.copy: Focused preparation for short- and long-track Gymnasium entrance exams covering algebra, geometry, and applied word problems.

items.name: BMS/HMS/FMS exam prep
items.copy: Structured roadmap for HMS, BMS, and FMS entrance exams plus the BM2 final exam with practical drill sessions.

items.name: Exam coaching
items.copy: Enter the exam with confidence: timing, stress management, and review routines.

items.name: Ongoing support
items.copy: Continuous maths coaching during the school year ‚Äì assignments, tests, and skill consolidation.

items.name: Crash courses
items.copy: Intensive refreshers close to the exam to close gaps and build confidence.

steps.title: Diagnose
steps.description: Evaluate current performance, define goals, and understand study habits.

steps.title: Plan
steps.description: Create a weekly learning roadmap with curated materials and scheduled sessions.

steps.title: Progress
steps.description: Track results, provide actionable feedback, and adjust strategy if needed.

results.title: Results & social proof
results.description: Hear directly from families who trust Teodoro Morcone Nachhilfe.

reviewSummary.headline: Consistent progress and lasting confidence
body: Parents highlight multi-year coaching that rebuilt confidence, sharpened study habits, and delivered sustained grade improvements.
Students appreciate the patient, multilingual tutoring style that makes complex math approachable and even fun.
reviewSummary.note: All reviews come from real clients; sources are linked or documented with the provider (status: November 2025).

about.title: About the tutor
about.body: I‚Äôm Teodoro Morcone, a math tutor in Zurich and founder of Teodoro Morcone Nachhilfe‚Äîa Business Economist (FH) and unabashed numbers person. Born in Zurich and raised in Ticino, I bridge the German- and Italian-speaking perspectives. I help students build solid foundations, train strategically for Gymnasium, BMS, HMS, and FMS admissions, and stay consistently engaged throughout the school year. My approach combines step-by-step explanations, tiered practice packets, realistic mock exams, and weekly progress tracking‚Äîplanned, measurable, effective. Lessons are delivered in German, Italian, and English, exclusively online via Zoom. Off the clock I‚Äôm into strength training and programming‚Äîthe same structured discipline flows directly into my tutoring.

plans.name: Single session
plans.unit: per 60 minutes ‚Äî final price in CHF; service not VAT-registered. No additional payment fees.

plans.name: 13-pack
plans.unit: 13 √ó 60 minutes (CHF 50 per lesson, approx 3 lessons per week) ‚Äî final price in CHF; service not VAT-registered. No additional payment fees.

items.question: How do reschedules and cancellations work?
items.answer: Gymnasium entrance exam prep sessions can be moved or cancelled free of charge up to 24 hours in advance. Late changes (< 24h) or no-shows are billed in full so that reserved slots remain available for other candidates.

items.question: What materials do you use?
items.answer: I blend proprietary practice sets, official Zurich education department papers, adaptive drills mapped to your diagnostic results, and annotated solution walk-throughs. All resources are shared digitally with versioned feedback.

items.question: Is tutoring exclusively online?
items.answer: Yes. Sessions run on Zoom with collaborative whiteboard work, breakout problem drills, and optional recordings of key solution frameworks so you can review afterwards.

items.question: How quickly do you respond to inquiries?
items.answer: Typically within 24 hours on business days you receive proposed time slots, a mini goal analysis, and‚Äîif helpful‚Äîa prep sheet to complete before the diagnostic call.

items.question: How do payments work?
items.answer: All lessons and packages are prepaid via Stripe payment link (e.g., card, Twint). Sessions are confirmed once the Stripe payment clears, and receipts are emailed automatically.

items.question: How is personal data handled?
items.answer: Personal data is processed solely for lesson delivery in line with Swiss revDSG. Analytics and tracking scripts load only after your consent, and Zoom recordings require written approval.

items.question: Do you cover specific BMS/HMS/FMS components?
items.answer: Yes. I cover the full competency profile for BMS, BM2, HMS, and FMS, including quantitative reasoning, essay prompts, and full-length simulations scored against official rubrics.

howTo.title: Mini how-to: prepare for success
howTo.intro: A structured plan helps reduce stress and deliver consistent exam performance.

steps.name: Assess & set goals
steps.description: Review recent tests, collate grade history, define target scores, and identify bottlenecks while drafting the roadmap worksheet.
notes: Run a diagnostic test if needed.
Share briefing notes with guardians for under-16 learners.

steps.name: Strengthen foundations
steps.description: Revisit priority topics through micro-sprints, tackle adaptive practice sets, and document error patterns directly in the shared whiteboard workspace.
notes: Update the shared progress dashboard after each sprint.

steps.name: Simulate & refine
steps.description: Run proctored mock exams under timed conditions, debrief with scoring rubrics, and reinforce pacing, mindset, and rest strategies.
notes: Build mental strategies and scheduled breaks.
Assemble a final exam-day checklist and reinforcement plan.

howTo.disclaimer: The plan is tailored individually ‚Äì I'll finalise the details during the initial consult.

comparison.title: Compare your options
comparison.description: Choose the setup that fits your learning goals.
comparison.footnote: All prices exclude VAT (service not VAT-registered). Approximate monthly counts and totals assume consistent scheduling.

entries.definition: Central admission exam for Zurich‚Äôs long-track or short-track Gymnasium.
Berufsmaturit√§tsschule ‚Äì combines vocational training with general education.
Second vocational baccalaureate pathway for EFZ graduates with a condensed maths final exam and complementary general education.
Full exam simulation under real conditions to build familiarity with format and timing.

sections.heading: 1. Scope
body: These terms and conditions govern the agreement between Teodoro Morcone, sole proprietorship ‚ÄúTeodoro Morcone Nachhilfe‚Äù (the ‚ÄúProvider‚Äù), and clients booking mathematics tutoring services.
Different provisions apply only if confirmed in writing.

sections.heading: 2. Services & lesson format
body: Lessons are generally delivered online. The exact medium or location is agreed upon during booking.
Lesson content, scope, and objectives are defined during the consultation or booking process.

sections.heading: 3. Booking via Calendesk / contract formation
body: Appointments are scheduled through Calendesk. Once Calendesk confirms the booking, the contract is formed; Calendesk‚Äôs terms of use also apply.
Availability shown in the calendar may change. The Provider may decline a request or suggest alternatives.

sections.heading: 4. Pricing & payment via Stripe
body: Current prices are published on the website.
All lessons and packages are prepaid via Stripe payment link (e.g., card, Twint); Stripe‚Äôs terms apply in addition.
Invoices and receipts are emailed automatically immediately after payment.

sections.heading: 5. Cancellation, rescheduling & no-shows
bullets: Sessions can be cancelled or rescheduled free of charge up to 24 hours before the start time.
Late cancellations, reschedules (< 24h), or no-shows are billed at 100% of the lesson price.
Should the client arrive late, the session still ends at the scheduled time; no additional time is owed.
If the Provider must cancel due to illness or unforeseen circumstances, prepaid fees are credited or an alternative appointment is offered.

sections.heading: 6. Client responsibilities
body: Clients ensure punctuality and an appropriate learning environment (for online lessons: stable internet connection plus functioning camera/microphone).
For minor learners, booking and consent must be provided by a parent or legal guardian.

sections.heading: 7. Lesson materials & copyright
body: Materials supplied by the Provider are protected by copyright and may be used only for personal learning.
Sharing or publishing the materials without permission is prohibited.

sections.heading: 8. Liability
body: Tutoring provides learning support; no guarantee is given for specific grades or exam results.
Statutory liability for wilful misconduct or gross negligence remains unaffected.

sections.heading: 9. Withdrawal / refunds
body: There is no statutory right of withdrawal for tutoring services already delivered.
Refunds follow clause 5 or apply if the Provider cancels (see clause 5.4).

sections.heading: 10. Governing law & jurisdiction
body: Mandatory venues remain reserved. For claims brought by consumers, the competent court is either at the consumer‚Äôs domicile or at the provider‚Äôs registered office; otherwise, Zurich applies.
Swiss substantive law governs.

sections.heading: 11. Changes to these terms
body: The Provider may amend these terms at any time.
The version published at the time of booking applies.

privacy.title: Privacy (summary)
privacy.intro: Snapshot of how Teodoro Morcone Nachhilfe handles personal data under Swiss law. Read the full privacy policy for complete details.

sections.heading: Data collection & sources
body: I operate exclusively in Switzerland under the Federal Act on Data Protection (FADP) and gather information when you send a request, schedule via Calendesk, join a Zoom lesson, or message me by email/chat.

My privately managed Swiss server stores truncated IP addresses, user-agent data, and security logs to protect the service. Consent decisions are documented, and optional Google Analytics 4 events run only after you opt in.
bullets: Contact details, learning goals, preferred availability, payment references, handwritten preparation notes
Security telemetry (truncated IP, device diagnostics) retained on Swiss infrastructure
No automated decision-making or profiling‚Äîevery booking and lesson plan is handled manually

sections.heading: Retention & deletion
body: Retention follows Swiss commercial obligations and documented privacy promises. Deletion requests go to privacy@teodoro.ch and are fulfilled once legal duties end.
bullets: Inquiry emails or chats without lessons: deleted after 12 months
Active learner profiles, lesson notes, materials: kept up to 3 years after the last session unless earlier deletion is allowed
Accounting records and payment receipts: stored for 10 years
Consent & cookie logs: retained for 5 years to evidence compliance
Security logs: rotated after 12 months; Google Analytics 4 data auto-expires after 14 months

sections.heading: Third-party services & transfers
body: Only a small, clearly defined set of processors support tutoring operations. Cross-border safeguards rely on FDPIC-recognised adequacy decisions or Standard Contractual Clauses.
bullets: **Swiss private hosting:** infrastructure located in Switzerland under my sole control
**Calendesk (Poland/EU):** scheduling, reminders, payment status within EU data centres
**Zoom (EU data residency, HQ USA):** lessons secured with waiting room, passcode, encryption; recordings require written consent and are deleted within 30 days
**Google Workspace & Google Analytics (EU/USA):** email, documents, optional analytics with SCCs, IP truncation, and no advertising features
**Meta Pixel (Meta Platforms, USA):** optional marketing measurement that loads only after explicit consent, governed by SCCs and IP obfuscation

sections.heading: How to exercise your rights
body: Email info@teodoro.ch or write to Teodoro Morcone Nachhilfe, Eichb√ºhlstrasse 33, 8004 Z√ºrich to request access, correction, portability, deletion, or consent withdrawal.

Identity is verified with proportionate steps and requests are handled within 30 days (extendable by another 30 days for complex cases). Cookie preferences can be adjusted anytime via the footer link.
bullets: Update or withdraw analytics consent without affecting essential services
Request erasure once statutory retention duties end; backups are purged during the next maintenance cycle
Escalate unresolved concerns to the Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner (FDPIC)

contact.title: Contact & booking
contact.description: Send a quick WhatsApp message with your goals, school level, and preferred timeframe ‚Äì the initial chat happens there. Subsequent Zoom sessions are coordinated together through Calendesk.
contact.bookingAvailabilityNote: Pick a convenient slot directly in the calendar widget.

cancellationItems: Sessions can be cancelled or rescheduled free of charge up to 24 hours in advance.
Late cancellations or no-shows are billed as a full lesson.
Payment is collected upfront via Stripe payment link (card, Twint); receipts are issued electronically.
minorsItems: For learners under 16, guardian consent is required.
Communication is coordinated with parents/guardians wherever possible.
Zoom profiles do not use full legal names of minors without permission.
